title: Next Champion will Introduce Sleep Crowd Control.

embed.description: is back with a new Champion Roadmap dev blog, now on the Nexus! This includes a few teasers for upcoming champion updates and our next upcoming champion! Continue reading for more info! Champion Roadmap: October 2017 "Welcome to another edition of Champion Roadmap!

body:
Mark My words. 

"The new mage will have unique abilities that haven’t been seen before in League, so hold onto your summoner spells and don’t fall asleep, because change is coming… cataclysmic change. Also, sparkles!".

Very self explanatory. Bubbles that make you sleep or something like that. Hopefully they make it so sleep is a long stun but if you receive damage it ends.

Sleep seems like an odd choice to put on a burst mage.

But then again, most burst mages have at least some form of cc so I guess its not that odd.

Sleep does usually feel like a type of peel cc though.

If all your abilities have different travel times, you could just time them to all hit the enemy at once. Lux would still be able to put out a ton of damage with her e+r, even if the enemy got out of her q right after they got hit.

The main issue with sleep tends to be that your ally could accidentally pop it in a team fight right after it gets applied. I think they'd have to give extra damage to whoever pops it (like Leona's passive) or make it so only this champ could pop it.

Sleep CC that ends when the champion takes damage would be so ridiculously useless. The only roles it might ever be useful for is support and maybe jungle during laning phase. It would be absolute trash in teamfghts with the AoE flying everywhere.
